taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family rosaceae;tribe rubeae;genus rubus;subgenus eubatus;section setosi;species nocivus;

treatment.description: Differing from no. 123 in its densely stiff-bristly or prickly primocane strongly glandular; petiole and petiolule of leaf densely glandular and retrorse-prickly; elliptic-obovate or ovate leaflets abruptly tipped, more than half as broad as long; raceme strongly glandular, the divergent pedicels mostly subtended by small or nearly obsolete stipule-like bracts.
